basic.floral_language:
Crassula pyramidalis Thunb
Floriography: natural, positive, tenacious
Crassula pyramidalis Thunb is a tall pyramid-like succulent, relatively symmetric, with needle or line shape green leaves tightly arranged, may become reddish color under a great diurnal temperature range and abundant sunlight. For its plant shape, often used for decoration in small pot succulent combos.
basic.color: Leaf color green, with adequate sunlight, leaves turning to red

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Like sunshine, dormant in summer under high temperatures, put in places with bright scattered light
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry, stop watering under summer high temperature
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once monthly in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
